column4: I'm on ubuntu 12.04, I've installed plymouth. But when I reboot the system I can't see the splash, because it so fast. How to fix that?
I was reading on this website ==> http://www.ubuntugeek.com/quick-tipplymouth-themes-in-ubuntu-10-04-lucid-lynx.html => but the info is TOO OLD
CPU Info: (8 CPU's - Intel Core(TM) i7-2600K CPU @, 3.41 GHz, (20% Load))
fyi "20% load" doesn't make any sense.  load is NOT a %
it is refering about cpu usage
i know what load is, you're a bit confused on the subject.
then don't call it "load" :)  load is NOT a % measurement
right an install script ;) "sudo apt-get install foo1 foo2 etc" is how i deal with that...
foo is a variable, insert what you really need in place ;)  it's a unix thing.
sorry, lol.  there is no foo package ;)
could you possible ask your question again - all on one line, so the entire channel can see it, thanks.
i still find that a bit unclear.  i guess i misunterpreted what you wanted the first time ;)  best of luck.
do you have a technical issue right now?  if not, it's OT (see "/msg ubottu ot" for details)?
